channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4683] How else could something so beautiful exist! [PIC]
[+2220] Newspaper Fail...!!
[+1957] Man Puts Crappy Rusty Car on Ebay, Sells For $226K
item.description: The eBay auction for this 1963 Pontiac LeMans Tempest started out innocently enough. Obtained after owner died. Opening bid was 500$. After one week, eBay seller 123ecklin will pocket $226,521 before auction fees. What happened between Day 1 and Day 9 is an amazing story.

item.title: [+1912] Joe Wilson cast deciding vote giving Rx coverage to illegals
item.description: Joe Wilson cast a deciding vote in 2003 giving prescription coverage to illegal immigrants

item.title: [+1879] Firm cancels health insurance coverage for 17 yr old
item.description: When 17-year-old Brianna Rice was diagnosed with celiac disease in February, she had health insurance. Now she doesn't. And she probably won't be able to get it for the rest of her life unless we reform the system.

item.title: [+1847] Neil Patrick Harris Mocks the Internet at the Emmys 2009
item.description: Dr Horrible’s Sing-Along Blog, the musical short film produced for Internet distribution, got a cameo appearance in tonight’s Emmys thanks to host (and Dr. Horrible star) Neil Patrick Harris.

item.title: [+1342] Leo Laporte Shows Off 1998 Ultimate Gaming Machine
item.description: A two part episode of The Screen Savers from 1998 where they talk about the Ultimate Gaming Machine of the day! (It's name is UGM, [pronounced uggum] and has been modded SO many times since version 1.0 shown here)

item.title: [+1244] Hm, yes, I guess our logos DO look kinda similar. Hm.
item.description: SoCal alarm service about to get a letter from NorCal games publisher.

item.title: [+1171] Sexy Girls of Oktoberfest [pics]
item.description: Oktoberfest is our kind of festival. It combines some of our favorite things in life: beer, food, and cleavage. In honor of the later, we have put together a gallery of the hottest girls of Oktoberfest, sporting their “Dirndl” – traditional dress.

item.title: [+1067] 'Death panels' author worked with big tobacco to stop reform
item.description: The person credited with inventing the “death panels” claim about health care reform worked with tobacco giant Phillip Morris to railroad health care reform in the Clinton administration, Rolling Stone magazine reports.

item.title: [+807] From Kristol to Beck: The Rise of Anti-Intellectualism
item.description: James Warren recalls the good old days of intelligent conservatism. what he doesn't say, understandably, is that, as neoconservatism became a dogma, and support for general common sense morphed into the loopiest fundamentalism and know-nothing populsim.

item.title: [+763] Did You Know These Things About the Internet? [Video]
item.description: This is another official update to the original "Shift Happens" video.

item.title: [+746] US proposes net neutrality rules
item.description: The US communications regulator proposes new rules that would require ISPs to respect the principle of "network neutrality".

item.title: [+716] House's Hugh Laurie: My realistic acting is crippling me
item.description: To find fame and fortune in America Hugh Laurie had to adopt a trademark limp for the role of Dr Gregory House.But that realistic limp could force him out of the TV series that earns him £250,000 an episode because of the pain of contorting his body.

item.title: [+705] The Funniest Protest Signs Of 2009
item.description: A while back we collected the funniest protest signs from town halls, but we realized that wouldn't do it--there have been so many protests since then! We set to work to find the best of the year, but we need your help!

item.title: [+674] 5 Ways To Hack Your Brain Into Awesomeness
item.description: There are probably secrets the brain simply doesn't want us to know. But by no means should that stop us from tinkering around in there, using somewhat questionable and possibly dangerous techniques to make our brains do what we want.

item.title: [+624] German Youth Would Vote Pirate Party Into Parliament
item.description: Next week the German Pirate Party will compete in the elections for the German Parliament, but this week the country’s youth already cast their votes. In the youth polls nearly 9% of all votes went to the Pirate Party, a result that the party hopes to match in the upcoming election.

item.title: [+587] Skype CEO Lobbies for Skype's right to be used over 3G
item.description: Skype CEO John Silverman will be lobbying in DC Monday to defend Skype's right to be used over 3G networks and not just over wifi on phones. “If it is allowed to work over the 3G network, then Skype starts to challenge the voice services of the cellular providers, something that isn’t likely to be viewed favorably by Ma Bell and its cohorts.“

item.title: [+582] Music teacher jailed for lesbian affair with pupil
item.description: Helen Goddard, a public school mistress who was ''pressured'' into a lesbian affair by a 15-year-old pupil, wept as she was jailed for 15 months.

item.title: [+553] Monkey Island 2 in 3D CRYENGINE
item.description: With the revival of the Monkey Island franchise, Loneclone used the original 2D settings from 'Monkey Island 2: Le Chuck's Revenge' and created 3D effect through CRYENGINE. The results are just amazing as seen in the video and screenshots.
